All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
BaseCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
BaseDate
Encapsulates date and time functionality for tasks in the Mario application.
ByeCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
Deadline
Abstract base class and its subclasses representing different types of tasks within the Mario application.
DeadlineCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
DeleteCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
Event
Abstract base class and its subclasses representing different types of tasks within the Mario application.
EventCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
FindCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
FinddateCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
ListCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
MarioDateTimePassed
This exception is thrown when an input date has already passed the current date.
MarioErrorExecutingCommand
This exception is thrown when an error occurs during the execution of a command.
MarioMissingDateTime
This exception is thrown when no date and time are detected in the input provided by the user.
MarioMissingTask
This exception is thrown when no task description is detected in the user's input.
MarioWrongFormat
This exception is thrown when the user input does not match the expected format.
MarkCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
Parser
Parser class is responsible for interpreting and converting user input strings into executable command objects within the Mario chat application.
PostponeCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
Storage
The Storage class manages file operations for the Mario chat application, specifically for saving and loading tasks.
Task
Abstract base class and its subclasses representing different types of tasks within the Mario application.
TaskList
Represents a collection of tasks in the Mario application.
ToDo
Abstract base class and its subclasses representing different types of tasks within the Mario application.
ToDoCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
UI
The UI class in the Mario chat application provides methods for displaying messages and reading commands from the console.
UnmarkCommand
Abstract base class and its concrete subclasses representing commands that can be executed within the Mario application.
